answers.answer: See an Eye MD. Find one at www.aao.org and stop the heavy drinking.JCH IIMD

question: I'm 28 years old and over weight 5'11 230 lbs.  Around two months ago I experienced seeing haloes after a long night of drinking.  I went to the hospital never experiencing the symptoms before and they tested me for glacoma and I came up negative.  The next day everything was back to normal.  I just started experiencing  seeing the haloes again and it has been getting better, but I still have seen them for the past four days in a row.  I recently did some research on diabetes and think that might be the problem.  I have a couple of the symptoms of diabetes, but not enough to be sure. Should I seek immediate help or, should I try eye drops.  I have been staring at a computer alot as well which is not normal.  Please help!
title: Haloes at night.
